Article.ArticleTitle: Two new alkaloids from Dendrobium nobile Lindl. exhibited neuroprotective activity, and dendrobine alleviated Aβ<sub>1-42</sub> -induced apoptosis by inhibiting CDK5 activation in PC12 cells.

AbstractText: Dendrobium nobile Lindl. is registered in the Chinese Pharmacopoeia as a traditional medicine. Phytochemical investigation of the ethanol extract of D. nobile Lindl. stems yielded three alkaloid compounds, including two new compounds dendroxine B (2) and denrine B (3) as well as one known compound dendrobine (1). Here, we identified the structure of these compounds using spectroscopic analyses and compared them with those described in previous studies. Compounds 1-3 were found to show protective effect against amyloid-β 1-42 (Aβ<sub>1-42</sub> )-induced neurotoxicity in rat pheochromocytoma (PC12) cells, among which dendrobine exhibited the most significant neuroprotective effect. Hoechst 33342/propidium iodide staining indicated that dendrobine ameliorated Aβ<sub>1-42</sub> -induced apoptosis. Moreover, quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction and western blot analysis analysis demonstrated that dendrobine suppressed the activation of cyclin-dependent kinase 5 (CDK5), upregulated Bcl-2 expression, and downregulated Bax, cyto-c, and caspase-3 expression. Molecular docking analysis and surface plasmon resonance assay suggested that dendrobine directly bound to CDK5 protein with a KD value of 2.05 × 10<sup>-4</sup>  M. In summary, alkaloids are the neuroprotective constituents of D. nobile Lindl., and dendrobine protected PC12 cells against Aβ<sub>1-42</sub> -induced apoptosis by inhibiting CDK5 activation.
